original: Paṭṭhānapakaraṇa
analyzed: paṭṭhāna pakaraṇa
translated: The Paṭṭhāna Treatise🔽The reverse order of the law of conditionality, the triplets beginning with “condition”

original: Dhammapaccanīyānuloma (4), Dukatikapaṭṭhānapāḷi (3)🔽21.5. Cūḷantaraduka, Kusalattika🔽Naappaccayaṁ nakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā sappaccayo kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ.🔽Naappaccayaṁ naakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā sappaccayo akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: dhamma paccanīya anuloma duka tika paṭṭhāna pāḷi  cūḍantaraduka kusalattika  na appaccayam na kusalam dhammam paccayā sappaccayaḥ kusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā ekam pe avigate eka  na appaccayam na akusalam dhammam paccayā sappaccayaḥ akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā ekam pe avigate eka
translated: The short section in the middle, the triplets on the wholesome

original: Naappaccayaṁ naabyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca sappaccayo abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā ekaṁ, adhipatiyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ.🔽Naasaṅkhataṁ …pe…. (Sappaccayadukasadisaṁ.)
analyzed: na appaccayam na abyākatam dhammam paṭicca sappaccayaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā eka adhipatiyā ekam pe avigate eka  na a saṅkhatam pe sat paccaya duka sadisa
translated: With a condition that is not wholesome as condition, a wholesome conditioned phenomenon arises, conditioned by root cause. (In brief.) With root cause as condition, one … with ignorance as condition, one … With ignorance as condition, one … With a condition that is not wholesome as condition, an unwholesome conditioned phenomenon arises, conditioned by root cause. (In brief.) With root cause as condition, one … With ignorance as condition, one … With a condition that is not wholesome as condition, an unwholesome conditioned phenomenon arises, conditioned by root cause. (In brief.) With root cause as condition, one … With ignorance as condition, one … With a condition that is not indeterminate as condition, an indeterminate conditioned phenomenon arises, conditioned by root cause. (In brief.) With root cause as condition, one … With predominance as condition, one … With ignorance as condition, one … With a condition that is not indeterminate as condition, an indeterminate conditioned phenomenon arises, conditioned by root cause. (In brief.) With root cause as condition, one … With predominance as condition, one … With ignorance as condition, one … With a condition that is not unconditioned as condition … (Like the section on “with a condition that is wholesome as condition,” but in brief.)

original: Nasanidassanaṁ nakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā anidassano kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: na sanidassanam na kusalam dhammam paccayā anidassanaḥ kusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā ekam pe avigate eka
translated: With a condition that is not visible as condition, a non-visible conditioned phenomenon arises, conditioned by root cause. (In brief.) With root cause as condition, one … With ignorance as condition, one … With a condition that is not visible as condition, a non-visible conditioned phenomenon arises, conditioned by root cause. (In brief.) With root cause as condition, one … With ignorance as condition, one …

original: Nasanidassanaṁ naakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā anidassano akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: na sanidassanam na akusalam dhammam paccayā anidassanaḥ akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā ekam pe avigate eka
translated: With an object that is not demonstrable, there arises a state that is not wholesome and is not demonstrable. (In brief.) (From) cause, (there is) one … (From) non-conflict, (there is) one.

original: Nasanidassanaṁ naabyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca sanidassano abyākato dhammo uppajjati🔽hetupaccayā. Nasanidassanaṁ naabyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca anidassano abyākato dhammo🔽uppajjati hetupaccayā. Nasanidassanaṁ naabyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca sanidassano abyākato
analyzed: na sa nidassanam na abyākatam dhammam paṭicca sa nidassanaḥ abyākataḥ dhammo uppajjati  hetu paccayā na sa nidassanam na abyākatam dhammam paṭicca anidassanaḥ abyākataḥ dhammo  uppajjati hetu paccayā na sa nidassanam na abyākatam dhammam paṭicca sa nidassanaḥ abyākataḥ
translated: With an object that is not demonstrable, there arises a state that is not to be directly known and is not demonstrable.🔽With an object that is not demonstrable, there arises a state that is not to be directly known and is not demonstrable.

original: ca anidassano abyākato ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi,
analyzed: ca anidassanaḥ abyākato ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi
translated: With an object that is not demonstrable, there arises a state that is not to be directly known and is not demonstrable. (In brief.) (From) cause, (there are) three …

original: adhipatiyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: adhipatiyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: (From) predominance, (there are) three … (From) non-conflict, (there are) three.

original: Nasappaṭighaṁ nakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā appaṭigho kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: na sappaṭigham na kusalam dhammam paccayā appaṭighaḥ kusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā ekam pe avigate eka
translated: With an object that is not a condition, there arises a state that is not a condition and is not a condition. (In brief.) (From) cause, (there is) one … (From) non-conflict, (there is) one.

original: Nasappaṭighaṁ naakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā appaṭigho akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ.🔽Nasappaṭighaṁ naabyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca sappaṭigho abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi, adhipatiyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽Naarūpiṁ nakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā arūpī kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ.🔽Naarūpiṁ naakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā arūpī akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: na sappaṭigham na akusalam dhammam paccayā appaṭighaḥ akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā ekam pe avigate eka  na sappaṭigham na abyākatam dhammam paṭicca sappaṭighaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi adhipatiyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi  na arūpim na kusalam dhammam paccayā arūpī kusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā ekam pe avigate eka  na arūpim na akusalam dhammam paccayā arūpī akusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā ekam pe avigate eka
translated: With a non-receptive, unwholesome, … (in brief, as in § 1). … With a non-receptive, indeterminate, … (in brief, as in § 1).🔽With a non-formless, indeterminate, … (in brief, as in § 1).🔽With a non-formless, unwholesome, … (in brief, as in § 1).🔽

original: Narūpiṁ naabyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca rūpī abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā ekaṁ, adhipatiyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: na rūpim na abyākatam dhammam paṭicca rūpī abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā eka adhipatiyā ekam pe avigate eka
translated: With a non-receptive and an unwholesome as condition, a non-receptive unwholesome … (Abbreviated.) … With a non-receptive and an indeterminate as condition, a non-receptive indeterminate … (Abbreviated.) … With a non-receptive and an unwholesome as condition, a non-receptive unwholesome … (Abbreviated.) … With a non-receptive and an indeterminate as condition, a non-receptive indeterminate … (Abbreviated.) … With a non-receptive and an unwholesome as condition, a non-receptive unwholesome … (Abbreviated.) … With a non-receptive and an indeterminate as condition, a non-receptive indeterminate … (Abbreviated.) … With a non-receptive and an unwholesome as condition, a non-receptive unwholesome … (Abbreviated.) … With a non-receptive and an indeterminate as condition, a non-receptive indeterminate … (Abbreviated.) … With a non-receptive and an unwholesome as condition, a non-receptive unwholesome … (Abbreviated.) … With a non-receptive and an indeterminate as condition, a non-receptive indeterminate … (Abbreviated.) … With a non-receptive and an unwholesome as condition, a non-receptive unwholesome … (Abbreviated.) … With a non-receptive and an indeterminate as condition, a non-receptive indeterminate … (Abbreviated.) … With a non-receptive and an unwholesome as condition, a non-receptive unwholesome … (Abbreviated.) … With a non-receptive and an indeterminate as condition, a non-receptive indeterminate … (Abbreviated.) … With a non-receptive and an unwholesome as condition, a non-receptive unwholesome … (Abbreviated.) … With a non-receptive and an indeterminate as condition, a non-receptive indeterminate … (Abbreviated.) … With a non-receptive and an unwholesome as condition, a non-receptive unwholesome … (Abbreviated.) … With a non-receptive and an indeterminate as condition, a non-receptive indeterminate … (Abbreviated.) … With a non-receptive and an unwholesome as condition, a non-receptive unwholesome … (Abbreviated.) … With a non-receptive and an indeterminate as condition, a non-receptive indeterminate … (Abbreviated.) … With a non-receptive and an unwholesome as condition

original: Nalokuttaraṁ nakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā lokiyo kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: na lokuttaram na kusalam dhammam paccayā lokiyaḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a supramundane, wholesome state as condition, a mundane, wholesome state arises – due to root-cause condition.

original: Nalokuttaraṁ nakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā lokuttaro kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: na lokuttaram na kusalam dhammam paccayā lokuttaraḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a supramundane, wholesome state as condition, a supramundane, wholesome state arises – due to root-cause condition.

original: (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā dve …pe… avigate dve.
analyzed: saṅkhitta hetuyā dve pe avigate dve
translated: (In brief:) With root-cause condition, there are two; with absence of root-cause condition, there are two.

original: Nalokuttaraṁ naakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā lokiyo akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ.🔽Nalokiyaṁ naabyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca lokiyo abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: na lokuttaram na akusalam dhammam paccayā lokiyaḥ akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā ekam pe avigate eka  na lokiyam na abyākatam dhammam paṭicca lokiyaḥ abyākataḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a supramundane, unwholesome state as condition, a mundane, unwholesome state arises – due to root-cause condition. (In brief:) With root-cause condition, there is one; with absence of root-cause condition, there is one.🔽With a mundane, indeterminate state as condition, a mundane, indeterminate state arises – due to root-cause condition.

original: Nalokuttaraṁ naabyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca lokiyo abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽(Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā dve, adhipatiyā dve …pe… avigate dve.
analyzed: na lokuttaram na abyākatam dhammam paṭicca lokiyaḥ abyākataḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā  dve adhipatiyā dve pe avigate dve
translated: With a supramundane, indeterminate state as condition, a mundane, indeterminate state arises – due to root-cause condition.

original: Nakenaci viññeyyaṁ nakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā kenaci viññeyyo kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: na kenacid viññeyyam na kusalam dhammam paccayā kenacid viññeyyaḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: (In brief:) With root-cause condition, there are two; with absence of root-cause condition, there are two. With predominance condition, there are two; with absence of predominance condition, there are two. With support condition, there are two; with absence of support condition, there are two. With proximity condition, there are two; with absence of proximity condition, there are two. With contiguity condition, there are two; with absence of contiguity condition, there are two. With absence condition, there are two; with non-absence condition, there are two. With disappearance condition, there are two; with non-disappearance condition, there are two. With cessation condition, there are two; with non-cessation condition, there are two. With exhaustion condition, there are two; with non-exhaustion condition, there are two. With fading away condition, there are two; with non-fading away condition, there are two. With fall condition, there are two; with non-fall condition, there are two. With death condition, there are two; with non-death condition, there are two. With birth condition, there are two; with non-birth condition, there are two. With future condition, there are two; with non-future condition, there are two. With past condition, there are two; with non-past condition, there are two. With present condition, there are two; with non-present condition, there are two. With unarisen condition, there are two; with non-unrisen condition

original: Nakenaci naviññeyyaṁ nakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā kenaci naviññeyyo kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.🔽Nakenaci viññeyyaṁ nakusalañca nakenaci naviññeyyaṁ nakusalañca dhammaṁ paccayā kenaci viññeyyo kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi. (Sabbattha nava.)
analyzed: na kenaci na viññeyyam na kusalam dhammam paccayā kenaci na viññeyyaḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi  na kenaci viññeyyam na kusalam ca na kenaci na viññeyyam na kusalam ca dhammam paccayā kenaci viññeyyaḥ kusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi sabbattha nava
translated: With an object that is not-to-be-directly-known, a wholesome consciousness arises that is not-to-be-directly-known, with a wholesome object, by way of root-cause condition … three.🔽With an object that is to-be-directly-known and with an object that is not-to-be-directly-known, a wholesome consciousness arises that is to-be-directly-known, with a wholesome object, by way of root-cause condition … three. (All nine triads.)

original: Nakenaci viññeyyaṁ naakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā kenaci viññeyyo akusalo dhammo uppajjati🔽hetupaccayā. Nakenaci naviññeyyaṁ naakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā kenaci naviññeyyo akusalo🔽dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā nava …pe… avigate nava.
analyzed: na kenaci viññeyyam na akusalam dhammam paccayā kenaci viññeyyaḥ akusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati  hetu paccayā na kenaci na viññeyyam na akusalam dhammam paccayā kenaci na viññeyyaḥ akusalo  dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā nava pe avigate nava
translated: With an object that is to-be-directly-known and with an object that is not-to-be-directly-known, an unwholesome consciousness arises that is to-be-directly-known, with an unwholesome object, by way of root-cause condition.🔽With an object that is not-to-be-directly-known, an unwholesome consciousness arises that is not-to-be-directly-known, with an unwholesome object, by way of root-cause condition. (Abbreviated.) In the section on root-cause, there are nine. … In the section on undetermined, there are nine.

original: Nakenaci viññeyyaṁ naabyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca kenaci viññeyyo abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā nava, adhipatiyā nava …pe… avigate nava.
analyzed: na kenacid viññeyyam na abyākatam dhammam paṭicca kenacid viññeyyaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā nava adhipatiyā nava pe avigate nava
translated: With an object that is to-be-directly-known and with an object that is not-to-be-directly-known, an indeterminate consciousness arises that is to-be-directly-known, with an indeterminate object, by way of root-cause condition. (Abbreviated.) In the section on root-cause, there are nine. In the section on predominance, there are nine. … In the section on undetermined, there are nine.
